structure.unit: ARTICLE CI. SOUTH MIAMI-DADE DEVELOPMENT AGENCY

text.section:
Sec. 2-1482. Composition.
Membership. Members of the Agency shall serve without compensation. The voting membership, reflecting the ethnic, racial, and gender diversity of Miami-Dade County, shall be composed of the designated representatives of each of the following organizations:
Chamber South
Perrine Cutler Ridge Council
Vision Council
Greater Homestead/Florida City Chamber of Commerce
Everglades National Park
Biscayne National Park
Tropical Everglades Visitor Association
City of Homestead
City of Florida City
Empowerment Zone-Florida City Neighborhood Assembly
Empowerment Zone-Homestead Neighborhood Assembly
West Perrine CDC
Goulds CDC
Naranja-Princeton CDC
South Miami Heights CDC
Princeton CDC
Leisure City OCED
Haitian Organization for Women
Unique Coalition of Minority Businesses (UCOMB)
Greater Miami Convention & Visitors Bureau
Cutler Ridge Business Improvement District
Naranja Lakes Community Redevelopment Agency
Park of Commerce (Rockefeller Group)
Homestead Air Reserve Base
Agri-Council
Florida Nurserymen and Growers Association
Dade County Farm Bureau
Everglades Coalition
Beacon Council
Greater Miami Chamber of Commerce
Coalition of Florida Farmworkers Organizations
Dade County Public Schools Region 5
Dade County Public Schools Region 6
Miami-Dade Community College-Homestead Campus
Job Corps
University of Miami
Florida International University
University of Florida
Urban Land Institute/Southeast Council
Newly Incorporated Municipalities within the geographic boundaries of this article
Board of County Commission District Eight Office (ex officio)
Board of County Commission District Nine Office (ex officio)
South Miami-Dade State Legislative Districts (ex officio)
Miami-Dade County Mayor's Office (ex officio)
South Miami-Dade Congressional Districts (ex officio)
City of Palmetto Bay
If any Member's designated representative also holds a federal, state, or local elected office, that representative shall serve in an ex officio capacity. No person may serve simultaneously as the designated representative for more than one Member. Additional Members may be added as set forth in the by-laws. Vacancies shall be filled in the same manner by which the original representatives were appointed, with a special emphasis on choosing persons representative of the gender, racial and ethnic composition of the entire community.
Removal of Members. Members and designated representatives may be removed in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 2-11.38 of the Code of Miami-Dade County.
Tenure. Terms shall be established by the Agency by-laws.
Qualifications. Each Member and designated representative must comply with the requirements of Chapter 2-11.38 of the Code of Miami-Dade County.
Organization and procedure.
Officers. The Agency shall organize after the Members and designated representatives thereof have qualified to serve and shall elect one (1) of its representatives as chairperson and such other officers as may be necessary. In addition, the Agency shall make, adopt and amend by-laws, rules and regulations for its own governance.
Meetings. The Agency shall hold regular meetings and such other meetings as it deems necessary. Quorum shall be defined in the Agency by-laws. Minutes shall be kept of all meetings and all meetings shall be public.
Committees. The Agency shall appoint any committees it deems necessary.
